subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In mainland China, Japan and Korea, the inner dots of the character is written as {{l|mul|⿰[[⺀]][[⺀]]}}. * In Taiwan, Hong Kong and Vietnam, the inner dots of the character is written as {{l|mul|冫}} and its mirror image {{l|mul|⿱[[㇀]][[⼂]]}}. * When this character is used as an upper radical component, the form is different depending on the script used. ** For {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Ming typeface}} ([[明體]]/[[明朝体]]): *** In mainland China, Japan, Korea and Vietnam, the radical component resembles {{l|mul|⻗}} (U+2ED7) with four horizontal lines which is also the historical form used in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. *** In Taiwan and Hong Kong, the radical component resembles the character itself (with {{l|mul|冫}} and its mirror image) but the lower right hook of {{l|mul|冂}} is omitted. ** For {{w|regular script}} ([[楷書]]): *** In mainland China and Japan, the radical component resembles the character itself (with {{l|mul|⿰[[⺀]][[⺀]]}}) but the lower right hook of {{l|mul|冂}} is omitted. *** In Taiwan and Hong Kong, the radical component resembles the character itself (with {{l|mul|冫}} and its mirror image) but the lower right hook of {{l|mul|冂}} is omitted.

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – a cloud with drops of rain falling from it.

subSections.title: Definitions
Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|あめ|yomi=k}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|雨|tr=same||rain}}. Found both alone and in compounds. Perhaps derived from {{IPAchar|/same/}} → {{IPAchar|/ame/}} with loss of the initial {{IPAchar|/s/}}; see ''same'' reading below for more.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|さめ|yomi=k}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|雨|tr=ame||rain}}.

Appears as the latter part in older compounds with an ''-s-'' infix or prefix. It is unclear if this leading {{IPAchar|/s/}} is indicative of an earlier form (''same''), or if this was an {{w|epenthesis}} for [[euphony]] to avoid vowel clusters, or for other reasons. This {{IPAchar|/s/}} is also seen in {{m|ja|青|tr=ao|pos=becoming ''sao'' in old compounds}} and {{m|ja|稲|tr=ine|pos=becoming ''shine'' in old compounds}}.

Given that this {{IPAchar|/s/}} only ever appears interstitially, and given the semantics, this {{IPAchar|/s/}} may be cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} interfix {{m|ko|ᄉ|-ᄉ-|tr=-s-}} used to mark possession, much like {{cog|en|'s}}.
